comment: As a freshman professor Russell was a tough class to go through if you're online. While she does give four days to complete the exams, she uses lockdown browser and webcam for all of them and uses lockdown browser for quizzes. As long as you do the reading you should be fine but it's a lot when you have other classes as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Russell is a decent teacher. Most of her assignments are quizzes that require lockdown browser and test that require lockdown with webcam. Her tests are based on the textbook and her online lectures. Make sure to do the reading and watch her lectures and it should be an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Most weeks you'll have a chapter quiz and a homework assignment due by the end of the week. I suggest you actually take notes and study also; her tests use lockdown browser with webcam on. READ THE TEXTBOOK. Her recorded lectures do NOT cover everything that are on the tests and quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Despite there being weekly quizzes, discussions and a research paper due in this course, the 3 exams (all using a lockdown browser with webcam) count for 50% of your grade. This is too much, and penalizes those who aren't great at memorization. She also gives very little to no feedback on the research paper drafts.

Although some of the questions on her quizzes were worded oddly, overall shes a pretty decent professor and the class is easy. If your able to read, write and comprehend pretty well then this class will be an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Participation matters

comment: She has a quiz due one week and a week and discussion due the next week. Her grading for discussions is easy, she grades off the rubric which you can see before completing the discussion. Her tests are easy since theyre based off the reading and pre-recorded lectures she has. She does have a lot of reading assigned that has a lot of content.

Good professor, a lot of quizzes, midterm, and final. Her quizzes are not hard and if you follow the directions of the discussions you will make a 100. Her midterm was easy too. Im taking it as online might be different in person but I enjoyed this class. She drops 3 lowest quiz grades. Know the syllabus before you email.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was insanely difficult for no reason. The quizzes are timed however many questions there are so if there is 5 questions you have about 6 minutes. The questions are very difficult and specific especially coming from a non- criminal justice major.

Two exams count for 60% of your grade. Weekly quizzes drops lowest three. Lecture slides don't have the needed info. Stopped posting lecture videos halfway thru course just posts lecture notes now. Weekly quizzes and bi weekly module discussions. I got an 86% on my midterm and have 100's on every quiz and module discussion and only have a 90 avg.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: For someone who is not a Criminal Justice Major, I really enjoyed Prof. Russell's class. You can really tell she is passionate about law, and if you are an aspring lawyer, she is perfect! There were weekly journals that were super clear and easy! We also had weekly 5 question quizzes, but they were just to further your understanding. Loved her!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is just ugh. Don't take her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great teacher that loves what she does. The tests and quizzes are very challenging but she definitely tries her best to make you enjoy the class.

I would take her again if the tests were a little different. Majority of the class felt as if there was always more than one right answer on the test, but Professor Russell wants you to pick what she thinks is the best answer. Cancelled class a few times because she is a judge, so the stories are interesting. Textbook required, and A LOT of reading
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: She didn't input grades to D2L so I didn't know where I was the entire semester. It was a 3 hour class that met once a week and she lectured from start to finish. We had a 5-10 minute break. The tests are confusing, paper criteria isn't clear, lectures aren't available online, lots of group projects, maybe 4 take-home assignments the whole term.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's very interesting, and you can definitely tell that she loves what she does. She has a lot of interesting stories to tell. She invited speaker, so that made the class fun. She's very helpful outside of the classroom as well! If you read you will more than likely make an A, and if you don't just make sure you do study the vocab.

Professor Russel isn't clear with what is particulary "important". All she says is everything is important, resulting in a difficult time studying for the tests. There aren't many grades in this course, so what you make on tests determines your overall.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome professor. Works in the actual courtroom when not teaching, so you hear about a lot of real life experiences.  3 tests all multiple choice, 6 "quizzes".  5/6 quizzes were in class activities and 1/6 was an actual short answer one question quiz. Very fun and sweet. Would take again! Attend class and keep up with reading! No homework
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Sometimes lectures are long and boring. Very Enthusiastic about subject, but everyone in class is intimidated to answer questions because she normally  grills them (she's a judge btw. This course is more so of an intro to law school. Not a difficult course, but she makes it harder than what it is. Must have and read the book! Avoid if possible.

Great teacher who has a passion for the subject!  She uses real world info and brings speakers from the field.  She will work with you if you have questions.  She likes essay over multiple choice test and as long as you know the subject and have a basic understanding of the material and can explain it you will be fine!

Having a basic understanding of Criminal Procedure is very helpful. If you know that and case law you're pretty OK. Her grading style is all over the place. Some people do better than others for no discernible reason. You get used to the class after awhile then it's easy.
no longer at ksu

very interesting class, goes through majority of the book, talks a whole lot and does sign in role. three test essays very strict, if you pay attention you will do fine allows up to three absenses with excuse. must be there the last week for mock trial. would take her again
Do not take this professor.  She is really hard and her study guides are terrible.  I heard she is good for other classes, but do not take her for Police in America.

if the woman says "If you will..." on more damn time i will choke her!   she's nice, but tends to bait your answers in class discussion, you'll think you're right, then wrong then she'll tell you  you're right, a little difficult for me personally to sit through, but covers from the book, the first test was kind of out of left field.
her test are easy if you stay ontop of the lectures and assigned reading. Lectures are kind of boring. Must be abel to write at College level to do well in her class....

Not interest in helping students learn, obviously just started teaching. Made us go to the writing center, and the things I was counted off for on my paper were the things the writing center told me to do. Worst teacher I've ever had at Kennesaw. I'll transfer schools before I'll take her again.

lots of papers.  boring classs.  the final was not hard but the first exam was terrible.  she waited until the end of the semester to assign three writing assignments.  it was a requirement that you take your paper to the writing center.
Love this teacher, she is evry easy. 3 M/C tests, tells you what to study for the test. No HW no Papers. Takes attendance. Very fair teacher,loved her,loved her.

Very friendly, 3 m/c tests, which are easy, just study the questions from the book's website and cd. Takes attendance. I like her a lot she is very fiendly and funny, class is really interesting, discussions are fun too. You won't fall asleep in her class.
